summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the Southern District of New York authorizing the forensic review of three hard drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement to travel, and conspiracy, specifically targeting communications, financial records, travel documents, and photographs involving Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and other co-conspirators and victims from 1994 to 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation; the hard drives were seized from his private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Explicitly named as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein; the warrant seeks evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

connections.description: The warrant identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the Subject Offenses (sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement).

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search at Jeffrey Epstein's private residence located at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, seizing three hard drives.

events.title: Search Warrant Issued
events.description: A magistrate judge issued this search warrant authorizing the forensic review of the hard drives seized from Epstein's residence.

events.title: Period of Investigation
events.description: The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to violations occurring from 1994 through August 8, 2019.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's private residence, referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the issuing court)
keyFacts: Three specific 'Seagate Path 100' hard drives (with FBI barcodes E6433822, E6433824, E6433821) were seized from a bookshelf cabinet in an oval study at Epstein's New York home on July 11, 2019.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein and seeks evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

The search is authorized for evidence of specific federal crimes: sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 2422), enticement to travel (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423), and conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371).

The warrant details specific categories of evidence sought, including communications among co-conspirators, financial payment records, travel documents for victims, and nude or sexually suggestive photographs of individuals who appear to be teenage girls or younger.
The document indicates the warrant was issued under seal, with authorization to delay notice to the person whose property was searched, suggesting the investigation was ongoing and sensitive.
